intro: Pterocaulon glandulosum var. velutinum, commonly known as the velvetleaf pterocaulon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually in inflorescences that produce numerous blooms. The plant is known for its adaptability and can be found in various habitats, including forests and disturbed soils.
